Content.Measurement Context: Atomic resolution high-angle annular dark field scanning transmission electron microscopy (HAADF-STEM) imaging was performed on a JEOL Grand ARM300CF microscope with double aberration correctors at 300 kV.
Content.Refers To: The voltage used in the Atomic resolution high-angle annular dark field scanning transmission electron microscopy imaging.

Content.Measurement Context: Images were collected after ex-situ calcination of samples at 450° C.
Content.Refers To: The temperature at which the samples were calcinated.

Content.Measurement Context: Using a convergence semiangle of 22 mrad, and inner- and outercollection angles of 83 and 165 mrad, respectively.
Content.Refers To: The angles used in the imaging process.

Content.Measurement Context: A beam current of 11 pA was used with pixel time of 4 μs.
Content.Refers To: The beam current used and the pixel time.

Content.Measurement Context: XAS at the Re L3 edge (10535 eV) was executed on beamlines 4-1 and 9-3 at the Stanford Synchrotron Radiation Lightsource at the SLAC National Laboratory using a Si(220) double crystal monochromator.
Content.Refers To: The energy of the XAS at the Re L3 edge.

Content.Measurement Context: In a typical experiment, 30 mg of catalyst was crushed, sieved (80-120 mesh), and loaded into a 1 cm catalyst bed in a
Content.Refers To: The amount of catalyst used and the size of the catalyst bed in the experiment.

Content.Measurement Context: The elastic modulus of the hydrogel is 6.6 kPa, lower than that of the hydrogel prepared in Example 13 (10.6 kPa).
Content.Refers To: The elastic modulus of the hydrogel in different examples.

Content.Measurement Context: Samples were diluted with mesoporous silica (MCM-41) to have an absorption length of 2.0 with a fractional absorbance of Re of about 0.2.
Content.Refers To: The absorption length and fractional absorbance of the samples.

Content.Measurement Context: In-situ extended X-ray absorption fine structure (EXAFS) measurements, consisting of 9-16 scans, were collected at 50° C.
Content.Refers To: The number of scans in the EXAFS measurements and the temperature at which they were collected.
